title: Identify Font from I Love New York: Ingredients and Recipes
content:
Hi all,

I'm trying to identify this typeface used in I Love New York: Ingredients and Recipes. It's so familiar, but I can't recall the name nor can I find it in my type library. Any ideas?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [QuickPix Photo.jpeg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/typophile.com/files/QuickPix%20Photo.jpeg) | 100.79 KB |
author: Fiver

comments.content: Sorry but looks handwritten to me. All repeating letters look different (2 /e, 2 /p)
I think you may be right... Do you know of any similar fonts that it may be based on?

Reminds me of this previous [discussion](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/typophile.com/node/97524).  
Some you might find intresting: [Great Lakes Lettering](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/www.fontbros.com/foundries/great-lakes-lettering) (Jacob Riley), [Magpie Paper Works](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/shop.magpiepaperworks.com/category/fonts), [Emily Lime](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Emily_Lime), [Tart Workshop](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Tart_Workshop), [Jill Bell's](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/www.myfonts.com/person/Jill_Bell) (Swank), [Laura Wothington](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Laura_Worthington), [Sketch Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letters-numbers/sketch-script), [Anna Clara](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/trial-by-cupcakes/anna-clara), [Gemmadonati](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/eurotypo/gemmadonati), [Watson Steel Pen](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/voltage-ltd/vtg-watson-steel-pen), [Graduate](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontforecast/graduate), [Handsome Classic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725092748/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/handsome/classic)
Fantastic! And all new to me except Jill Bell's Swank! Thanks a million+.
